stem: A reactor is initially critical well below the point of adding heat (POAH) during a reactor startup. Control rods are withdrawn for 20 seconds to establish a 0.5 DPM startup rate. In response to the control rod withdrawal, reactor power will initially increase, and then... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: continue increasing until the control rods are reinserted.
choices.B: stabilize at a value slightly below the POAH.
choices.C: stabilize at the POAH.
choices.D: stabilize at a value slightly above the POAH. -739- PWR Test Items

stem: A reactor is initially critical below the point of adding heat during a reactor startup. If control rods are manually inserted for 5 seconds, reactor power will decrease...

choices.A: to a lower power level determined by subcritical multiplication.
choices.B: temporarily, then return to the original power level due to subcritical multiplication.
choices.C: temporarily, then return to the original power level due to a decrease in moderator temperature.
choices.D: until inherent positive reactivity feedback causes the reactor to become critical at a lower power level.

stem: A reactor is initially critical below the point of adding heat (POAH) during a reactor startup. If control rods are manually withdrawn for 5 seconds, reactor power will initially increase and then... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: stabilize at a critical power level below the POAH.
choices.B: decrease and stabilize at the original value.
choices.C: stabilize at a critical power level at the POAH.
choices.D: decrease and stabilize below the original value. -740- PWR Test Items

stem: A reactor has been shut down for three weeks with all control rods fully inserted. If a single control rod is fully withdrawn from the core, neutron flux level will… (Assume the reactor remains subcritical.)

choices.A: increase and stabilize above the original level.
choices.B: increase, then decrease and stabilize at the original level.
choices.C: increase, then decrease and stabilize above the original level.
choices.D: remain the same during and after the withdrawal.

stem: A reactor has been shut down for three weeks with all control rods fully inserted. If a center control rod is fully withdrawn from the core, neutron flux level will… (Assume the reactor remains subcritical.) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: remain the same.
choices.B: increase and stabilize at a new higher level.
choices.C: increase temporarily then return to the original level.
choices.D: increase exponentially until the operator reinserts the center control rod. -741- PWR Test Items

stem: Criticality has been achieved during a reactor startup. The core neutron flux level is low in the intermediate range with a stable 0.5 DPM startup rate (SUR). The operator begins inserting control rods in an effort to stabilize the core neutron flux level near its current value. The operator stops inserting control rods when the SUR indicates exactly 0.0 DPM. Immediately after the operator stops inserting the control rods, the SUR will become __________; and the core neutron flux level will __________.

choices.A: positive; increase exponentially
choices.B: positive; increase linearly
choices.C: negative; decrease exponentially
choices.D: negative; decrease linearly

stem: The total amount of reactivity added by a control rod position change from a reference height to any other rod height is called... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: differential rod worth.
choices.B: excess reactivity.
choices.C: integral rod worth.
choices.D: reference reactivity. -742- PWR Test Items

stem: Integral control rod worth can be described as the change in __________ for a __________ change in rod position.

choices.A: reactor power; total
choices.B: reactivity; unit
choices.C: reactor power; unit
choices.D: reactivity; total

stem: Integral rod worth is the... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: change in reactivity per unit change in control rod position.
choices.B: rod worth associated with the most reactive control rod.
choices.C: change in worth of a control rod per unit change in reactor power.
choices.D: reactivity added by moving a control rod from one position to another position. -743- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following expresses the relationship between differential rod worth (DRW) and integral rod worth (IRW)?

choices.A: DRW is the area under the IRW curve at a given rod position.
choices.B: DRW is the slope of the IRW curve at a given rod position.
choices.C: DRW is the IRW at a given rod position.
choices.D: DRW is the square root of the IRW at a given rod position.

stem: Which one of the following parameters typically has the greatest influence on the shape of a differential rod worth curve? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Core radial neutron flux distribution
choices.B: Core axial neutron flux distribution
choices.C: Core xenon distribution
choices.D: Burnable poison distribution -744- PWR Test Items

stem: During normal full power operation, the differential control rod worth is less negative at the top and bottom of the core compared to the center regions due to the effects of...

choices.A: reactor coolant boron concentration.
choices.B: neutron flux distribution.
choices.C: xenon concentration.
choices.D: fuel temperature distribution.

stem: Which one of the following expresses the relationship between differential rod worth (DRW) and integral rod worth (IRW)? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: IRW is the slope of the DRW curve.
choices.B: IRW is the inverse of the DRW curve.
choices.C: IRW is the sum of the DRWs between the initial and final control rod positions.
choices.D: IRW is the sum of the DRWs of all control rods at a specific control rod position. -745- PWR Test Items

stem: As moderator temperature increases, the differential rod worth becomes more negative because...

choices.A: moderator density decreases, which causes more neutron leakage out of the core.
choices.B: the moderator temperature coefficient decreases, which causes decreased competition for neutrons.
choices.C: fuel temperature also increases, which decreases the rate of neutron absorption in the fuel.
choices.D: moderator density decreases, which increases the neutron migration length.

stem: A nuclear power plant is operating at 50 percent power with one group of control rods partially inserted into the core. If the moderator temperature decreases by 5°F, the group differential control rod worth will become... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: more negative, due to better moderation of neutrons.
choices.B: less negative, due to shorter neutron migration lengths.
choices.C: more negative, due to increased moderator absorption of neutrons.
choices.D: less negative, due to increased resonance absorption of neutrons. -746- PWR Test Items

stem: As moderator temperature increases, the differential rod worth becomes...

choices.A: more negative due to longer neutron diffusion lengths.
choices.B: more negative due to decreased resonance absorption of neutrons.
choices.C: less negative due to reduced moderation of neutrons.
choices.D: less negative due to decreased moderator absorption of neutrons.

stem: A reactor startup is in progress from a cold shutdown condition. During the reactor coolant heatup phase of the startup, the differential control rod worth will become __________ negative; and during the complete withdrawal of the initial bank of control rods, the differential control rod worth will become __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: more; more negative initially and then less negative
choices.B: more; less negative initially and then more negative
choices.C: less; more negative during the entire withdrawal
choices.D: less; less negative during the entire withdrawal -747- PWR Test Items

stem: The main reason for designing and operating a reactor with a flattened neutron flux distribution is to...

choices.A: provide even burnup of control rods.
choices.B: reduce neutron leakage from the core.
choices.C: achieve a higher average power density.
choices.D: provide more accurate nuclear power indication.

stem: Which one of the following is a reason for neutron flux shaping in a reactor core? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: To minimize local power peaking by more evenly distributing the core thermal neutron flux.
choices.B: To reduce thermal neutron leakage by decreasing the neutron flux at the periphery of the reactor core.
choices.C: To reduce the size and number of control rods needed to shut down the reactor during a reactor trip.
choices.D: To increase differential control rod worth by peaking the thermal neutron flux at the top of the reactor core. -748- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following includes two reasons for control rod bank/group overlap?

choices.A: Provides a more uniform differential rod worth, and minimizes axial neutron flux peaking.
choices.B: Provides a more uniform differential rod worth, and allows dampening of xenon-induced neutron flux oscillations.
choices.C: Ensures that all rods remain within the allowable tolerance between their individual position indicators and their group counters, and ensures rod insertion limits are not exceeded.
choices.D: Ensures that all rods remain within their allowable tolerance between individual position indicators and their group counters, and provides a more uniform axial flux distribution.

stem: Which one of the following includes two reasons for control rod bank/group overlap? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Provide a more uniform axial power distribution and provide a more uniform differential rod worth.
choices.B: Provide a more uniform differential rod worth and provide a more uniform radial power distribution.
choices.C: Provide a more uniform radial power distribution and maintain individual and group rod position indicators within allowable tolerances.
choices.D: Maintain individual and group rod position indicators within allowable tolerances and provide a more uniform axial power distribution. -749- PWR Test Items

stem: One purpose of using control rod bank/group overlap is to...

choices.A: ensure adequate shutdown margin.
choices.B: provide a more uniform differential rod worth.
choices.C: allow dampening of xenon-induced neutron flux oscillations.
choices.D: ensure control rod insertion limits are not exceeded.

stem: A reactor was restarted following a refueling outage and is currently at the point of adding heat. Which one of the following describes the change in axial power distribution as reactor power is increased to 5 percent by control rod withdrawal? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Shifts toward the bottom of the core.
choices.B: Shifts toward the top of the core.
choices.C: Shifts from the center of the core toward the top and bottom of the core.
choices.D: Shifts from the top and bottom of the core toward the center of the core. -750- PWR Test Items

stem: By maintaining the radial and axial core power distributions within their prescribed limits, the operator is assured that __________ will remain within acceptable limits.

choices.A: power density (kW/foot)
choices.B: shutdown margin
choices.C: core delta-T
choices.D: rod insertion limits

stem: Consider a reactor core with four quadrants: A, B, C, and D. The reactor is operating at steady-state 90 percent power when a fully withdrawn control rod in quadrant C drops to the bottom of the core. Assume that no operator actions are taken and reactor power stabilizes at 88 percent. How are the maximum upper and lower core power tilt values (sometimes called quadrant power tilt ratio or azimuthal power tilt) affected by the dropped rod? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Upper core value decreases while lower core value increases.
choices.B: Upper core value increases while lower core value decreases.
choices.C: Both upper and lower core values decrease.
choices.D: Both upper and lower core values increase. -751- PWR Test Items

stem: After a control rod is fully inserted (from the fully withdrawn position), the effect on the axial flux shape is minimal. This is because... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: the differential rod worth is constant along the length of the control rod.
choices.B: the fully inserted control rod is an axially uniform poison.
choices.C: a control rod only has reactivity worth if it is moving.
choices.D: a variable poison distribution exists throughout the length of the control rod. -752- PWR Test Items

stem: The control rod insertion limits generally rise as reactor power increases because…

choices.A: the power defect becomes more negative as power increases.
choices.B: the control rod worth becomes more negative as power increases.
choices.C: the fuel temperature coefficient becomes more negative as power increases.
choices.D: the equilibrium xenon-135 reactivity becomes more negative as power increases.

stem: KNOWLEDGE: K1.15 [3.4/3.9] QID: P1055 Control rod insertion limits are established for power operation for all the following reasons except… NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: adversely affect core power distribution.
choices.B: provide adequate shutdown margin.
choices.C: cause reduced control rod lifetime.
choices.D: minimize the consequences of an uncontrolled rod withdrawal. -753- PWR Test Items

stem: Control rod insertion limits ensure that control rods will be more withdrawn as reactor power __________ to compensate for the change in __________.

choices.A: increases; xenon reactivity
choices.B: decreases; xenon reactivity
choices.C: increases; power defect
choices.D: decreases; power defect

stem: Why are control rod insertion limits established for power operation? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: To minimize the worth of a dropped control rod.
choices.B: To maintain a negative moderator temperature coefficient.
choices.C: To provide adequate shutdown margin after a reactor trip.
choices.D: To ensure sufficient positive reactivity is available to compensate for the existing power defect. -754- PWR Test Items

stem: A reactor has been operating at 80 percent power for four weeks with the secondary control rods inserted 10 percent from the fully withdrawn position. Which one of the following will be most affected by inserting the secondary control rods an additional 5 percent? (Assume steady-state reactor power does not change.)

choices.A: Rod insertion limits
choices.B: Radial power distribution
choices.C: Quadrant (azimuthal) power distribution
choices.D: Axial power distribution

stem: A reactor is operating at steady-state 75 percent power. Assuming the reactor does not trip, which one of the following compares the effects of dropping (full insertion) a center control rod to the effects of partially inserting (50 percent) the same control rod? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: A dropped rod causes a greater change in shutdown margin.
choices.B: A dropped rod causes a smaller change in shutdown margin.
choices.C: A dropped rod causes a greater change in axial power distribution.
choices.D: A dropped rod causes a greater change in radial power distribution. -755- PWR Test Items

stem: A reactor is operating at steady-state 75 percent power. Assuming the reactor does not trip, which one of the following compares the effects of dropping (full insertion) a center control rod to the effects of partially inserting (50 percent) the same control rod?

choices.A: A partially inserted rod causes a greater change in axial power distribution.
choices.B: A partially inserted rod causes a greater change in radial power distribution.
choices.C: A partially inserted rod causes a greater change in shutdown margin.
choices.D: A partially inserted rod causes a smaller change in shutdown margin.

stem: A reactor is operating at steady-state 75 percent power. Assuming the reactor power does not trip, which one of the following compares the effects of dropping (full insertion) a center control rod to the effects of partially inserting (50 percent) the same control rod? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: A dropped rod causes a smaller change in axial power distribution.
choices.B: A dropped rod causes a smaller change in radial power distribution.
choices.C: A dropped rod causes a smaller change in shutdown margin.
choices.D: A dropped rod causes a greater change in shutdown margin. -756- PWR Test Items

stem: A reactor is operating at steady-state 85 percent power. Assuming the reactor does not trip, which one of the following compares the effects of partially inserting (50 percent) a center control rod to the effects of dropping (full insertion) the same control rod?

choices.A: A partially inserted rod causes a smaller change in axial power distribution.
choices.B: A partially inserted rod causes a smaller change in radial power distribution.
choices.C: A partially inserted rod causes a greater change in shutdown margin.
choices.D: A partially inserted rod causes a smaller change in shutdown margin.

stem: A reactor is operating at steady-state 100 percent power at the beginning of a fuel cycle. Assuming the reactor does not trip, which one of the following compares the effects of dropping a control rod in the center of the core to dropping an identical control rod at the periphery of the core? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Dropping a center control rod causes a greater change in shutdown margin.
choices.B: Dropping a center control rod causes a smaller change in shutdown margin.
choices.C: Dropping a center control rod causes a greater change in axial power distribution.
choices.D: Dropping a center control rod causes a greater change in radial power distribution. -757- PWR Test Items

stem: A reactor is operating at steady-state 100 percent power when one control rod at the core periphery falls completely into the core. Assuming no reactor trip and no operator action, which one of the following will change significantly as a result of the dropped rod? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Axial power distribution only.
choices.B: Axial power distribution and shutdown margin.
choices.C: Radial power distribution only.
choices.D: Radial power distribution and shutdown margin. -758- PWR Test Items
